io.straas.android.sdk.messaging

Class ChatRoomManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.straas.android.sdk.messaging.ChatRoomManager

  • public class ChatRoomManager
extends java.lang.Object
    ChatRoomManager is used to manage a chat room or a message board.

    To construct a ChatRoomManager, you have to call use initialize(io.straas.android.sdk.base.interfaces.OnResultListener<io.straas.android.sdk.messaging.ChatRoomManager, io.straas.android.sdk.base.credential.CredentialFailReason>) to get your result. This method will check your developer credential, if it succeed, you will get a ChatRoomManager. Then, you can call connect(java.lang.String, io.straas.android.sdk.base.identity.Identity, boolean, io.straas.android.sdk.messaging.interfaces.EventListener) to connect to a chat room and start using other methods to use the chat room.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(OnResultListener<ChatRoomManager,CredentialFailReason> callback)
        Constructs a ChatRoomManager if you are a authorized developer. If check passes, developer will get a ChatRoomManager. If not, developer will receive a CredentialFailReason.
        Parameters:
        callback - Receives the initialization result.

      • connect

        public void connect(@NonNull
                    java.lang.String channelId,
                    @NonNull
                    Identity identity,
                    boolean autoCreate,
                    @NonNull
                    EventListener eventListener)
        Connects to a chat room.

        This method should only be called when the chat room state is ChatRoomState.IDLE.

        Parameters:
        channelId - Target channel id.
        identity - The user connecting to a chat room. see Identity. If token in the identity is null, This person will login as a guest named "Guest".
        autoCreate - Set this true if you want to create a chat room with the channel id when target channel doesn't exist. This feature needs to be enabled by the server side. Please contact StraaS.io support for further information.
        eventListener - Listens result of connection and other events. See EventListener.

      • getMessages

        public void getMessages(int page,
                        int perPage,
                        @NonNull
                        OnResultListener<Message[],MessagingError> listener)
        Gets messages in this chat room.

        This method should only be called when the chat room state is ChatRoomState.CONNECTED.

        Parameters:
        page - Target page of messages. The newest message will be at page 1.
        perPage - Message count of per page. The max value is 100.
        listener - OnResultListener. Developer will receive messages if task succeeds. If not, developer will receive the MessagingError for failure reason.

      • getUsers

        public void getUsers(int page,
                     int perPage,
                     @NonNull
                     OnResultListener<User[],MessagingError> listener)
        Gets users in this chat room.

        This method should only be called when the chat room state is ChatRoomState.CONNECTED.

        Parameters:
        page - Target page of users. The minimum number is 1.
        perPage - User count of per page. The max value is 200.
        listener - OnResultListener. Developer will receive users if task succeeds. If not, developer will receive the MessagingError for fail reason.

      • getChatRoomInfo

        public void getChatRoomInfo(@NonNull
                            OnResultListener<ChatRoomInfo,MessagingError> listener)
        Gets ChatRoomInfo of current chat room.

        This method should only be called when the chat room state is ChatRoomState.CONNECTED.

        Parameters:
        listener - OnResultListener. Developer will receive ChatRoomInfo if task succeeds. If not, developer will receive the MessagingError for fail reason.

      • updateNickname

        public void updateNickname(java.lang.String name,
                           OnResultListener<java.lang.Void,MessagingError> listener)
        Updates current user's nick name to server.

        This method should only be called when the chat room state is ChatRoomState.CONNECTED and the current user is a guest.

        Parameters:
        name - New nick name.
        listener - OnResultListener. Developer will receive the MessagingError for fail reason if task fails.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String message,
                        OnResultListener<java.lang.Void,MessagingError> listener)
        Sends message to chat room.

        This method should only be called when the chat room state is ChatRoomState.CONNECTED.

        Parameters:
        message - Message.
        listener - OnResultListener. Developer will receive the MessagingError for fail reason if task fails.

      • getSendMessageCoolDown

        public int getSendMessageCoolDown()
        Returns rest send-message cool down from now.

        This method should only be called when the chat room state is ChatRoomState.CONNECTED.

        Returns:
        Rest send-message cool down.

      • getCurrentUser

        public User getCurrentUser()
        Returns current user.

        This method should only be called when the chat room state is ChatRoomState.CONNECTED.

        Returns:
        Current user.

      • getMemberCount

        public int getMemberCount()
        Returns member count gotten from local cache. This value would be a rough count of current member count.

        This method should only be called when the chat room state is ChatRoomState.CONNECTED.

        Returns:
        Member count gotten from local cache.

      • getGuestCount

        public int getGuestCount()
        Returns guest count gotten from local cache. This value would be a rough count of current guest count.

        This method should only be called when the chat room state is ChatRoomState.CONNECTED.

        Returns:
        Guest count gotten from local cache.

      • getChatRoomState

        public ChatRoomState getChatRoomState()
        Returns current chat room state.
        Returns:
        ChatRoomState.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnect from current server. After disconnection finishes, EventListener.onDisconnected() that was set in connect(java.lang.String, io.straas.android.sdk.base.identity.Identity, boolean, io.straas.android.sdk.messaging.interfaces.EventListener) will be invoked.

        This method should only be called when the chat room state is ChatRoomState.CONNECTED or ChatRoomState.CONNECTING.
